frame.name: Communication_response
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame deals with communicating a reply or response to some prior communication or action. </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun: <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue</fex> <t>responded</t> to the objection convincingly.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue</fex> gave a convincing <t>response</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue's</fex> <t>response</t> was convincing.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person to whom the response is communicated. When expressed, this FE occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to": <ex>Sue <t>answered</t> <fex name="Add">Bob</fex> immediately.</ex> <ex>Sue <t>responded</t> <fex name="Add">to Bob</fex> immediately.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the FE that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.<ex><fex name="Msg">"I can't help you,"</fex> Sue <t>answered</t>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>replied</t> <fex name="Msg">that she couldn't help</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:<ex>My boss still hasn't given me an <t>answer</t> <fex name="Top">about a promotion</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>As with <fen>Medium</fen> in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by "on" or "in":<ex>Sue <t>responded</t> to my question <fex name="Medium">on the telephone</fex>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>replied</t> <fex name="Medium">in writing</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Trigger
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.<ex>Sue <t>answered</t> <fex name="Trig">the question</fex>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>responded</t> <fex name="Trig">to the questionnaire</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
